title: A map for Wabi
name: A map for Wabi
description:
A Map by Phototron

A map of cherished places and hidden jems.

properties.name: Atomic Ale
properties.description: Posted by Phototron 1015 Lee Blvd., Richland, WashingtonGreat beer, old micro brew in Richland, Wa. Lot\'s of refrences to the Richlands atomic past, you can even get a pretzel in the shape of an atom. With beers names things like: Half-Life Hefeweizen, Atomic Amber, and Plutonium Porter how could you go wrong.

properties.name: Bluebird Inn - oldest bar in Washington
properties.description: Posted by Phototron     121 E Market St Bickleton, WA 99322The Bluebird Inn in Bickleton Washington high in the horse heven hills is the longest operating bar in the state. They have a 1903 Brunswick pool table still in use. Bickleton the town where the Bluebird is located in pretty small, a population of about 90 or so, mostly wheat farmers. I had friends in Bickleton as a kid and always wanted to go here before it was family friendly. Bickleton is also home of the oldest rodeo in the state which they hold every summer along with a picnic. During the rodeo weekend they pull out there Herschell-Spillman carousel and give rides for fifty cents. The carousel was originally built in 1905, and was purchased from Oaks Park in Portland, Or in 1929.

properties.name: Chamna Park
properties.description: Posted by Phototron   richland Wadirt trails down by the Yakima river. Great for walking, wonderful for mountain biking (fun jumps). Runs next to the river from I-182 to 240 bridge. One of the old things i miss about Richland. It was so close to my last house.

properties.name: Hanford Reach
properties.description: Posted by Phototron This is part of a refuge borders the hanford nuclear facility. and from about this spot of a little farther up you can see Last standing structure of the old towns that were once one the other side of the river. You cannot get to the shell of the Old Hanford high school (the building farther back in the image) across the river because it is garded, but it is interesting to see it standing there. The reach is also beautiful for hiking, and you can only rarely see anything from the reactors. Just watch out for snakes and ticks. mostly ticks ick!

properties.name: Octopus Garden
properties.description: Posted by Phototron 1327 George Washington Way, Richland, WALots of weird and fun things. nothing else like this in the Tri-city area.

properties.name: Richland Community Center
properties.description: Posted by Phototron I like community. Big pretty windows and comfy chairs and free foosball. Possible fun classes to take with old people. Organize community events here. I went to some Tri-City vegetarian/vegan potlucks here.

properties.name: Sacajawea State Park
properties.description: Posted by Phototron  Really beautiful park, nice in the summer. Washington state has more money again so they should stop charging for admittence. trail that go back to a train bridge, and possible minor remains of a ghost town called Answorth.

properties.name: Schlagel Park
properties.description: Posted by PhototronPasco, WAOne of may riverside parks in Pasco. Popular with young lovers. Sandwiched between a marina and a Train bridge. You can walk up to and under the train bridge. Pasco is a big shipping town so alot of hobos come though often sleeping under this bridge for a night. Also because this train bridge is so busy it not a good choice to walk across.

properties.name: Spudnut shop
properties.description: Posted by Phototron  228 Williams Boulevard Richland, WA 99352Spudnuts are awsome! Spudnuts are unique because they use potato flour, and wow they taste great. They also have spuffins!

properties.name: The Delta
properties.description: Posted by PhototronEntrance to a great place to walk around. Very pretty but sometimes you find kind of gross stuff. Popular place with dogs.

properties.name: Unofficial park by the Yakima river (even has parking)
properties.description: Posted by Phototron  Richland WaWonderful little trails winding though Russian Olive trees. Some people like to fish here but you SHOULD NOT eat them if you do, the river is full of farm waste. But, it is a really wonderful place to spend a hot day in some green grass in the shade.

properties.name: Viera's Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Phototron  430 W Lewis St Pasco, waViera\'s is a really great mexican bakery. I think it\'s the best in Pasco. You can make yoursel f sick for three or four dollars here (in a good way, you\'ll be full). and if that\'s not cheap enough, the day old are practically free. They also makes cakes for weddings and quinceaneras.
